item.title: Scientists links laptops to detect earthquakes (Washington Post)
item.description: Elizabeth Cochran sensed an opportunity to save lives when she realized laptops can be used as seismometers to detect earthquakes.

item.title: Beckham on target as Galaxy rock Earthquakes (Times of Malta)
item.description: David Beckham... one goal for LA Galaxy. David Beckham scored one goal and set up another in a 2-0 Los Angeles Galaxy win over the San Jose Earthquakes yesterday. The England midfielder played the full 90 minutes, helping the home side post their first victory of the 2008 Major League Soccer season.

item.title: Beckham on target as Galaxy rock Earthquakes (Reuters via Yahoo! News)
item.description: David Beckham scored one goal and set up another in a 2-0 Los Angeles Galaxy win over the San Jose Earthquakes on Thursday.

item.title: Seismologist's Project Uses Public's Laptops To Monitor And Predict Earthquakes (Science Daily)
item.description: An idea for monitoring earthquakes that a seismologist came up with two years ago is now being realized, and has the potential to save lives in case an earthquake strikes. Her idea involves inviting the public to help monitor earthquakes by simply using their laptop computers at home. In doing so, the laptops join a network of computers designed to take a dense set of measurements that can help ...

item.title: Beckham scores first MLS goal in Galaxy win over Earthquakes (Gulf Times)
item.description: LOS ANGELES: England midfielder David Beckham scored his first goal in Major League Soccer play on Thursday and contributed to another as the Los Angeles Galaxy defeated the San Jose Earthquakes 2-0.

item.title: Becks scores in Galaxyâ€™s win over Earthquakes (The Star)
item.description: CARSON: David Beckham scored one goal and set up another in a 2-0 Los Angeles Galaxy win over the San Jose Earthquakes on Thursday. The England midfielder played the full 90 minutes, helping the home side post their first victory of the 2008 Major League Soccer season.

item.title: Beckham scores season's first goal in Galaxy's 2-0 win over Earthquakes (Canadian Press via Yahoo! News)
item.description: CARSON, Calif. - David Beckham scored his first goal in a Major League Soccer game and assisted on another to help the Los Angeles Galaxy win their home opener, 2-0 over the expansion San Jose Earthquakes on Thursday night.

item.title: Beckham on target as Galaxy rock Earthquakes (rediff.com)
item.description: David Beckham scored one goal and set up another in a 2-0 Los Angeles Galaxy win over the San Jose Earthquakes on Thursday. The England midfielder played the full 90 minutes, helping the home side win their first game of the Major League Soccer season.

item.title: San Jose Earthquakes Fall 2-0 Against the Galaxy in Return to MLS (OurSports Central)
item.description: CARSON, Calif. -- In their first game in more than two years, the San Jose Earthquakes renewed some friendships. But the Quakes learned two lessons rather quickly: first-year teams have struggled in recent years and David Beckham is now a full-fledged member of Major League Soccer.

item.title: Possible link found between earthquakes along the Cascadia and San Andreas faults (EurekAlert!)
item.description: San Francisco (April 3, 2008) -- Seismic activity on the southern Cascadia Subduction fault may have triggered major earthquakes along the northern San Andreas Fault, according to new research published by the Bulletin of Seismological Society of America (BSSA). The research refines the recurrence rate for the southern portion of the Cascadia fault to approximately every 220 years for the last ...
